com.ftdi.j2xx.interfaces

Interface I2cMaster

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FT_4222_I2c_Master

    public interface I2cMaster

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getStatus(int deviceAddress, byte[] controllerStatus)
      Read the status of the I2C master controller.
      int init(int kbps)
      Initialize the device as I2C master with the requested I2C speed.

      Read data from the specified I2C slave device with START and STOP conditions.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        int init(int kbps)
        Initialize the device as I2C master with the requested I2C speed.
        Parameters:
        kbps - The speed of I2C transmission.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • reset

        int reset()
        Reset the I2C master device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • read

        int read(int deviceAddress,
       byte[] buffer,
       int sizeToTransfer,
       int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the specified I2C slave device with START and STOP conditions.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • readEx

        int readEx(int deviceAddress,
         int flag,
         byte[] buffer,
         int sizeToTransfer,
         int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the specified I2C slave device with the specified I2C condition.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        flag - The I2C condition will be sent with this I2C transaction. flags is a bit-mask of I2C_MasterFlag#NONE, I2C_MasterFlag#START, I2C_MasterFlag#Repeated_START, I2C_MasterFlag#STOP and I2C_MasterFlag#START_AND_STOP.
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • write

        int write(int deviceAddress,
        byte[] buffer,
        int sizeToTransfer,
        int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the specified I2C slave device with START and STOP conditions
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • writeEx

        int writeEx(int deviceAddress,
          int flag,
          byte[] buffer,
          int sizeToTransfer,
          int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the specified I2C slave device with the specified I2C condition.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        flag - The I2C condition will be sent with this I2C transaction. flags is a bit-mask of I2C_MasterFlag#NONE, I2C_MasterFlag#START, I2C_MasterFlag#Repeated_START, I2C_MasterFlag#STOP and I2C_MasterFlag#START_AND_STOP.
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • getStatus

        int getStatus(int deviceAddress,
            byte[] controllerStatus)
        Read the status of the I2C master controller. This can be used to poll a slave until its write-cycle is complete.
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        controllerStatus - Buffer array that contains the to be return status data.
        Returns:
        0 if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.
